Convert Ensembl Identifiers to Gene Symbols

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/convertGenesToSymbols-methods.R
convertGenesToSymbols.Rd

Convert Ensembl Identifiers to Gene Symbols

convertGenesToSymbols(object, ...)

convertSymbolsToGenes(object, ...)

# S4 method for character
convertGenesToSymbols(object, gene2symbol = NULL,
  organism = NULL, build = NULL, release = NULL)

# S4 method for matrix
convertGenesToSymbols(object, gene2symbol = NULL,
  organism = NULL, build = NULL, release = NULL)

# S4 method for sparseMatrix
convertGenesToSymbols(object,
  gene2symbol = NULL, organism = NULL, build = NULL,
  release = NULL)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
convertGenesToSymbols(object)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
convertSymbolsToGenes(object)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
gene2symbol

Gene2Symbol or NULL. Gene-to-symbol mappings. If set NULL, the function will attempt to download the mappings from Ensembl automatically.
organism

string. Full latin organism name (e.g. "Homo sapiens").
build

string or NULL. Genome build assembly name (e.g. "GRCh38"). If set NULL, defaults to the most recent build available.
release

scalar integer or NULL. Release version (e.g. 90). If set NULL, defaults to the most recent release available.

Value

Object with gene IDs converted to names (symbols).

See also

Other Identifier Mapping Functions: Ensembl2Entrez, Gene2Symbol, HGNC2Ensembl, MGI2Ensembl, Tx2Gene, convertTranscriptsToGenes, convertUCSCBuildToEnsembl, mapGenes

Examples

data(rse_small)
object <- rse_small

gene2symbol <- gene2symbol(object)
#> Warning: 'gene2symbol' is deprecated.
#> Use 'Gene2Symbol' instead.
#> See help("Deprecated")
print(gene2symbol)
#> Gene2Symbol 0.99.0
#> https://steinbaugh.com/basejump
#> citation("basejump")
#> DataFrame with 50 rows and 2 columns
#>                 geneID    geneName
#>            <character> <character>
#> gene1  ENSG00000000003      TSPAN6
#> gene2  ENSG00000000005        TNMD
#> gene3  ENSG00000000419        DPM1
#> gene4  ENSG00000000457       SCYL3
#> gene5  ENSG00000000460    C1orf112
#> ...                ...         ...
#> gene46 ENSG00000004059        ARF5
#> gene47 ENSG00000004139       SARM1
#> gene48 ENSG00000004142     POLDIP2
#> gene49 ENSG00000004399      PLXND1
#> gene50 ENSG00000004455         AK2
#> 50 genes; 50 symbols
genes <- head(gene2symbol[["geneID"]])

## character ====
x <- convertGenesToSymbols(genes, gene2symbol = gene2symbol)
print(x)
#> ENSG00000000003 ENSG00000000005 ENSG00000000419 ENSG00000000457 ENSG00000000460 
#>        "TSPAN6"          "TNMD"          "DPM1"         "SCYL3"      "C1orf112" 
#> ENSG00000000938 
#>           "FGR" 

## matrix ====
samples <- head(colnames(object))
counts <- matrix(
    data = seq_len(length(genes) * length(samples)),
    byrow = TRUE,
    nrow = length(genes),
    ncol = length(samples),
    dimnames = list(genes, samples)
)
print(counts)
#>                 sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4
#> ENSG00000000003       1       2       3       4
#> ENSG00000000005       5       6       7       8
#> ENSG00000000419       9      10      11      12
#> ENSG00000000457      13      14      15      16
#> ENSG00000000460      17      18      19      20
#> ENSG00000000938      21      22      23      24
x <- convertGenesToSymbols(counts, gene2symbol = gene2symbol)
print(x)
#>          sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4
#> TSPAN6         1       2       3       4
#> TNMD           5       6       7       8
#> DPM1           9      10      11      12
#> SCYL3         13      14      15      16
#> C1orf112      17      18      19      20
#> FGR           21      22      23      24

## SummarizedExperiment ====
x <- convertGenesToSymbols(rse_small)
#> Warning: 'gene2symbol' is deprecated.
#> Use 'Gene2Symbol' instead.
#> See help("Deprecated")
print(x)
#> class: RangedSummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 50 4 
#> metadata(3): version date interestingGroups
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames(50): TSPAN6 TNMD ... PLXND1 AK2
#> rowData names(5): geneID geneName geneBiotype broadClass entrezID
#> colnames(4): sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4
#> colData names(2): genotype treatment
## Interconvert back to gene IDs.
y <- convertSymbolsToGenes(x)
#> Warning: 'gene2symbol' is deprecated.
#> Use 'Gene2Symbol' instead.
#> See help("Deprecated")
print(y)
#> class: RangedSummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 50 4 
#> metadata(3): version date interestingGroups
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames(50): ENSG00000000003 ENSG00000000005 ... ENSG00000004399
#>   ENSG00000004455
#> rowData names(5): geneID geneName geneBiotype broadClass entrezID
#> colnames(4): sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4
#> colData names(2): genotype treatment
